attributes.action: Stop using SEN (special educational needs) schools as a polling station
attributes.background: A lot of SEN children require routine and struggle with the normal school breaks. Closing schools to use as a polling station can cause these children unnecessary anxiety and stress. They need the stability of school more than mainstream school children. Closing for one day has a huge impact on them

rejection.details:
It's local authorities' responsibility to decide where to locate polling stations. You could raise this issue with local councillors who represent you:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You could start a new petition calling for a ban on local authorities using SEN schools as polling stations.

You might like to sign this petition, which calls for a ban on local authorities using any school as a polling station:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/244383
